title: ATMOSPHERE
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: In the summer of 1980, Joan Goodwin begins training with a group of candidates for NASA’s space shuttle program.

title: CAUGHT UP
author: Navessa Allen
description: The second book of the Into Darkness series. Nico “Junior” Trocci and Lauren Marchetti become ensnared in a game of seduction.

title: ONE GOLDEN SUMMER
author: Carley Fortune
description: A photographer returns to a place where she spent a summer as a teenager and runs into the guy she had a crush on back then.

title: THE FIRST GENTLEMAN
author: Bill Clinton and James Patterson
description: When President Wright’s husband goes on trial for murder, a pair of journalists search for answers.

title: THE TENANT
author: Freida McFadden
description: Things take an unsettling turn when a marketing executive loses his job and a woman rents a room in his brownstone.

title: BEHIND THE BADGE
author: Johnny Joey Jones
description: The Fox News military analyst extols the first responders among his friends and family.

title: NOT MY TYPE
author: E. Jean Carroll
description: The journalist shares moments from her life and the two trials in which she accused President Trump of sexual assault and defamation.

title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
author: Bessel van der Kolk
description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION
author: Jonathan Haidt
description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.

title: WE MIGHT JUST MAKE IT AFTER ALL
author: Elyce Arons
description: Arons tells the story of her friendship with Kate Spade and the multibillion-dollar fashion company they founded.

title: DON'T BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU THINK, EXPANDED EDITION
author: Joseph Nguyen

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: IMPOSSIBLE CREATURES
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: A young boy is enlisted to save a place where magical creatures reside. (Ages 10 and up)

title: REFUGEE
author: Alan Gratz
description: Three children in three different conflicts look for safe haven. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)

title: GROWING HOME
author: Beth Ferry. Illustrated Terry Fan and Eric Fan
description: Talking plants, a grumpy goldfish and an inquisitive spider save the Tupper family from utter ruin. (Ages 6 to 9)

title: WHY A DAUGHTER NEEDS A DAD
author: Gregory E. Lang. Illustrated Sydney Hanson
description: A father's love for his daughter. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: I LOVE DAD WITH THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: Eric Carle
description: Celebrating dad with help from that insatiable insect. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: NOBODY HUGS A CACTUS
author: Carter Goodrich
description: A cantankerous cactus needs a hug. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: WHY A SON NEEDS A DAD
author: Gregory E. Lang. Illustrated Gail Yerrill
description: The bond between father and son. (Ages 4 to 7)

title: THE DAY THE CRAYONS MADE FRIENDS
author: Drew Daywalt. Illustrated Oliver Jeffers
description: Duncan throws a dinner party to meet all his crayons' new friends. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: THE SUMMER I TURNED PRETTY TRILOGY
author: Jenny Han
description: A beach house, summer love and enduring friendships. (Ages 12 and up)

title: THE POWERLESS TRILOGY
author: Lauren Roberts
description: A story of forbidden love between Paedyn, an Ordinary, and Kai, an Elite, in the kingdom of Ilya. (Ages 14 and up)

title: THE WILD ROBOT
author: Peter Brown
description: Roz the robot adapts to her surroundings on a remote, wild island. (Ages 7 to 12)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: written and illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: WINGS OF STARLIGHT
author: Allison Saft
description: Clarion, the successor to the throne of Pixie Hollow, is determined to confront a monster that threatens the land. (Ages 12 to 18)

title: WATCH ME
author: Tahereh Mafi
description: After 10 years, the Reestablishment looks to make a move on the New Republic of the West. (Ages 14 and up)

title: NOTHING LIKE THE MOVIES
author: Lynn Painter
description: In this sequel to "Better Than the Movies," Wes tries to win back the heart of Liz. (Ages 14 and up)

title: A FORGERY OF FATE
author: Elizabeth Lim
description: A girl agrees to marry a dragon lord to ensure her family's safety. (Ages 12 to 17)

title: HEARTLESS HUNTER
author: Kristen Ciccarelli
description: Rune, a witch, and Gideon, a witch-hunter, fall in love. (Ages 13 to 18)
